texto: defined in this document are not aligned to any specific stage in a software life cycle. All of the life cycle processes involve planning, performance, and evaluation activities that should be considered for use at every stage. Further elaboration of these concepts can be found in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24748 (all parts), on the application of life cycle management. 5.4.2 Life cycle model for the software system Every software system has a life cycle. A life cycle can be described using an abstract functional model that represents the conceptualization of a need for the system, its realization, utilization, evolution and disposal.
